Sentencas: A mechanical failure of a single component is sufficient to cause a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) breakdown.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses

Sentencas: As an unfavorable issue for interfering the stable operation of SOFCs, thermal stress stemming from temperature gradient and mechanical mismatch can result in crack damage.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses

Sentencas: Therefore, it is strongly significant to clarify the relationship of mechanical properties of the cell materials with distribution of the stress by taking into account the electrochemical reactions.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses

Sentencas: A complete three-dimensional model for a planar anode-supported SOFC has been proposed and established in this study, which includes governing equations for momentum, gas-phase species, heat, electron and ion transport.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses

Sentencas: The thermal gradients caused by the electrochemical reactions and heat transport processes of the counterflow leading to a maximum thermal stress is slightly larger than that is induced by the coflow.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses

Sentencas: The influence of mechanical mismatch is analyzed and the results indicate that the strength of stress at two sides of a cell tends to be enlarged under fixed constraint conditions.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses

Sentencas: Furthermore, the functional buffer layers can affect the stress between different components and inhibit the extent of degradation.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses

Sentencas: This investigation is expected to offer a path to improve the matches of SOFC components and optimize the stack design.
Titulo: Modeling of an anode supported solid oxide fuel cell focusing on thermal stresses
